page.title: 01Ewelme village
page.content: It is a small village with about 600 population and lying just off the road linking Henley and Oxford. The nearest town for shopping is Wallingford. There is a post office which also keeps a small stock of groceries, vegetables and magazines for sale. Nearby is the village hall and a short distance away lies a unique group of C15 buildings which comprise a church, some almshouses and a school which was once a grammar school. The founders of this group of buildings were William Duke of Suffolk and Alice, his wife. she was the grand daughter of the poet, Geoffrey Chaucer. In the chancel of the church is her beautiful alabaster tomb surmounted by an effigy of the Duchess who lies buried near the tomb of her parents.
